III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 08/27/2025, a youth was physically assaulted on Unit B3 twice
by another youth. During the assault, a staff member held the
victim youth down so the other youth could assault him.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was contacted on 08/29/2025 by phone.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 08/29/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another Department of Health and Human
Services (DHHS) Worker. Youth A stated he was transferred to
Unit 3B on 08/26/2025 and several youths asked him where he
was from. Youth A stated the youths did not believe he was from
Kalamazoo, Michigan. Youth A stated after group meeting on
08/27/2025 two youths came from behind and hit the back of his
head while he was seated in a chair. Youth A stated he fell to the
ground and a youth kicked his head. Youth A stated a female staff
held him down by placing her arms over his head for his safety.
Youth A stated the female staff then pulled him up and directed
him to go to his room. Youth A stated he went to his room as
Crisis Response Team (CRT) staff arrived on the unit. Youth A
stated he was in his room for less than 15 minutes and saw the
nurse. Youth A stated he was not injured. Youth A stated later that
day he was sitting at the table playing cards with a youth and the
same youth, who hit him earlier, hit him again and said, “Let’s start
poppin!” Youth A stated several fights started on the unit. Youth A
stated a youth punched him and he punched him back. Youth A
stated a youth pulled out one of his braids during the fight. Youth
A stated a male staff intervened and stood in front of Youth A to
block youths from hitting him. Youth A stated CRT staff came to
the unit and the fighting stopped when youths were escorted to
their rooms. Youth A stated there have not been additional fights
because three youths were transferred to another unit after the
second fight on 08/27/2025. Youth A stated he does not know the
2

names of the youths and staff involved in these two incidents
because he was new to the unit. Youth A stated the scratch on his
chin has healed and is no longer visible. Youth A was observed
with a bald spot on the top, left side of his head where his braid
was pulled out.
Youth B was interviewed on 09/02/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth B stated he
knew Youth A from the community. Youth B stated Youth A
approached him to fight and Youth B swung first because he did
not want to turn down the request. Youth B stated Youth A turned
around from his seated position and swung back. Youth B stated
he did not continue to fight because they used to be friends. Youth
B stated another youth swung at Youth A and Youth A fell to the
ground. Youth B stated another youth stood over Youth A and
punched Youth A and either the same youth or another youth
kicked Youth A when he was on the ground. Youth B stated a
female staff used her body to shield Youth A from being hit and no
one held Youth A down to be hit. Youth B stated a male staff held
Youth B to prevent him from fighting. Youth B stated he was not
on the unit during the second fight involving Youth A. Youth B
denied fighting new youths as an initiation to the unit.
Youth C was interviewed on 09/02/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth C stated
there was a big fight when Youth A was placed on Unit 3B, but he
does not know the reason behind it. Youth C stated he was not
involved in the first fight with Youth A, but involved in the second
fight. Youth C stated he and Youth A swung at each other and
other fights broke out on the unit. Youth C stated CRT staff arrived
on the unit. Youth C stated he resisted CRT staff physically
managing him and he and a CRT staff fell to the ground under a
table. Youth C stated he got up from the table and several CRT
staff escorted him to his room as he resisted. Youth C stated
Manager 1 and Manager 2 placed him in his room, they fell on to
his bed before he was released. Youth C stated he was not
injured in this incident. Youth C stated fighting is “normal stuff” on
Unit 3B and the fights involving Youth A were not initiation fights to
the unit. Youth C stated he did not want to disclose the names of
youth and staff involved in these fights.
Youth D was interviewed on 09/02/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth D stated he
did not witness the fight with Youth A or staff’s interventions
because he was fighting a youth (does not know who) that
punched him in the nose. Youth D stated staff intervened between
3

him and this youth and does not know which staff escorted Youth
D to his room. Youth D stated his bloody nose healed without
issue. Youth D stated he did not see the second fight that
occurred on 08/27/2025. Youth D stated he was new to Unit 3B
and does not know the names of youths and staff.
Youth E was interviewed on 09/11/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth E stated
staff intervened and separated Youth C and Youth F fighting
Youth A on 08/27/2025. Youth E stated he did not watch the fight
when asked to provide details of the incident. Youth E stated he
was involved in the second fight on 08/27/2025 and ran from staff
when they tried to intervene. Youth E stated Youth C and a CRT
staff were under the table, but he was placed in his room and did
not see what happened next. Youth E stated staff and CRT staff
put other youths in their room to prevent further fighting. Youth E
stated he did not recall details of the fight and which staff and CRT
staff were involved. Youth E stated he did not witness a staff hold
a youth down to be hit by a youth in this incident or any other
incident.
Youth F was interviewed on 09/11/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth F stated the
entire unit fought on 08/27/2025. Youth F stated he did not want to
talk about the fights. Youth F stated he fought Youth A because
he thought Youth A was someone else and did not clarify who he
is. Youth F stated staff did not hold Youth A down to be hit. Youth
F stated he no longer has conflict with Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 09/02/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated Unit 3B has
an increase in fights, which makes it difficult to recall the specific
details of each incident. Staff 1 stated he worked morning and
afternoon shift on Unit 3B on 08/27/2025. Staff 1 stated Youth A
was still seated after group meeting when Youth B hit Youth A.
Staff 1 stated Youth A did not fight back, but fell to the ground as
Staff 1 intervened with Youth B. Staff 1 stated Youth F stepped in
and kicked Youth A. Staff 1 stated he physically managed Youth F
and another staff assisted Youth A. Staff 1 stated in the afternoon
Youth C fought Youth A and Youth B may have also hit Youth A.
Staff 1 stated multiple fights occurred at the same time and he
was challenged on which incident took precedence. Staff 1 stated
he stood in front of Youth A, who was in the corner, and Staff 1
extended his arms to the side to prevent youths from getting to
Youth A. Staff 1 stated Youth A lost a hair braid during this
incident. Staff 1 stated CRT staff came to the unit in both incidents
4

to handle the physical management of youths and allow staff to
redirect the youths to stand by their door or go into their rooms to
de-escalate the unit. Staff 1 was asked if he saw a CRT staff
under the table with a youth. Staff 1 stated he did observe a CRT
staff under the table with a youth but the tabletop and the CRT’s
backside obstructed his view. Staff 1 stated the fights appear to be
Youth F, Youth E, and Youth B targeting the newer youths on the
unit for unknown reasons, but speculates it is an attempt to show
dominance on the unit.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 09/02/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS Worker. Staff 2 stated there was
tension on Unit 3B due to new youths placed on the unit. Staff 2
stated Youth B hit Youth A from behind and youths started to fight
Youth A. Staff 2 stated CRT staff responded to the assistance call.
Staff 2 stated he did not witness Youth A held down by staff and
hit during this incident. Staff 2 stated there may have been
another fight that afternoon, but is unsure due to the volume of
fights on the unit. Staff 2 stated the youths intentionally run on the
unit and start multiple fights to split up staff’s intervention.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 09/11/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS Worker. Staff 3 stated she did not
hold Youth A down to be hit on 08/27/2025. Staff 3 stated Youth A
was punched in the head without provocation by Youth F. Staff 3
stated Youth A went down on the ground and covered his head
with his hands and she redirected Youth F to stop hitting Youth A.
Staff 3 stated she pulled Youth A up by his hands and took him to
his room while Staff 1 physically managed Youth F to prevent him
from hitting or kicking Youth A. Staff 3 stated later that day she
heard a commotion and ran to the other side of the unit. Staff 3
stated she assisted by redirecting youths to stand by their rooms
due to the youths fighting, but does not recall Youth A being
involved. Staff 3 stated CRT staff responded and assisted.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 09/25/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 4 does not recall Youth A being involved in a fight
or being punched during a card game on 08/27/2025. Staff 4
stated when new youths are placed on a unit it may create tension
due to negative connections from the community. Staff 4 stated
unit staff work together and talk with the youths to facilitate the
transition of new youth placements.
CRT 1 was interviewed on 09/11/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS Worker. CRT 1 stated he
responded to a morning shift assistance call on Unit 3B and the
5

fighting was over when he arrived. CRT 1 stated Staff 1 had Youth
F secured away from Youth A. CRT 1 stated he assisted staff in
verbally redirecting the youths to their rooms to reset the unit.
CRT 1 stated he did not work afternoon shift on 08/27/2025.
CRT 2 was interviewed on 09/11/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS Worker. CRT 2 stated he does not
know Youth A and there are too many assistance calls to recall
the details of each one. CRT 2 stated there was an incident when
Youth C and a CRT staff fell under a table. CRT 2 stated he
assisted them off the ground. CRT 2 stated he initially did not
realize Youth C had his leg wrapped around another CRT’s leg to
resist the transport. CRT 2 stated Youth C was redirected to let go
of the CRT’s leg and then escorted to his room.
Manager 1 was interviewed on 09/25/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Manager 1 stated he responded to Unit 3B’s
assistance call on 08/27/2025. Manager 1 stated he placed Youth
C in a primary restraint technique hold and transported him to his
room for fighting. Manager 1 stated Youth C resisted and fell
forward to his bed while holding on to Manager 1’s shirt. Manager
1 stated he directed Youth C to let go of his shirt and he released
Youth C. Manager 1 stated he got up and left the room once
Youth C complied. Manager 1 stated Manager 2 was present
when he was inside Youth C’s room.
Manager 2 was interviewed on 09/25/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Manager 2 stated he responded to Unit 3B’s
assistance call. Manager 2 stated he observed Youth C resisting
Manager 1’s hold. Manager 2 stated he opened Youth C’s room
door. Manager 2 stated Youth C resisted and grabbed on to
Manager 1 as he fell on to the bed. Manager 2 stated Manager 1
and Youth C got up from the bed. Manager 2 stated Youth C,
Youth E, and Youth F were transferred to Unit 1D following this
incident to decrease their tension with Youth A.
Video
Unit 3B 08/27/2025 video shows around 09:32 AM Youth A sitting
in a chair and a youth walks up and hits Youth A’s head from
behind. Staff 1 intervenes by standing in front of Youth A. Youth A
falls to the ground when another youth hits Youth A in the face.
Staff 1 physically manages the youth that hit Youth A, but then
falls back into a chair. This youth kicks Youth A’s head and Staff 1
gets up and physically manages him. Staff 3 redirects a youth to
stay away. Staff 3 leans over Youth A to block the hits and pulls
6

him up from the ground and places him in his room located in the
other common area.
Unit 3B 08/27/2025 video shows around 14:58 PM Youth A being
hit by three youths. Staff including CRT staff intervene and Youth
A is placed in his room around 14:59 PM.
Documentation Reviewed
Incident reports written by Staff 2 and CRT 1 and MiSACWIS
incident reports were reviewed for the two fights involving Youth A
on 08/27/2025. The incident reports outline the interviews of the
fights.
08/27/2025 Nursing Progress Note states Youth A was evaluated
following a physical altercation. Youth A denied pain and injury.
Youth A was evaluated again after another physical altercation.
Youth A was observed with a scratch on the right side of his face.
Youth A complained of a headache and given an ice pack and
Motrin.
08/28/2025 Nursing Progress Note states Youth A was seen by
the medical doctor. Youth A complained of headache without
dizziness or blurred vision. Youth A was given Motrin and directed
to notify staff if his symptoms changed.
Staff 3 last attended Handle with Care training on 07/08/2025.
Staff 3 does not have a discipline history.
Unit Layout
Unit 3B has two common areas with rooms surrounding each
common area. In between the two common areas is a hallway that
separates the unit gym and the staff desk area and unit
classroom. There is no physical divider between the common
areas.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance in providing for the needs,
supervision, and protection of Unit 3B youths on 08/27/2025.
Interviews and video review do not support that Staff 3 held Youth
A down to be hit. It is found that staff and CRT staff acted timely
during the two Unit 3B fights involving Youth A on 08/27/2025.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
